page.title: 10BOWHOUSE FARM : DAIRYING
page.content: {Bowhouse farm}is situated around 0.75 kilometres to the south of Kinglassie. The farm is 65 hectares in size and is a{dairy farm}having been converted from an arable farm 12 years ago in order to allow the farmer to maximise his profits At the moment the herd is slowly being changed into a{pedigree herd}in order to produce better animals which in turn will give a better yield of milk, butterfat etc.The herd consists of 110 milking cows.The{average milk } {production for the herd is 5500 litres {per year,}the highest recorded yield being 9000 litres. Lately, dairy farmers have been hit by E.E.C. restrictions on milk production (8% reduction on output) but this has not affected Bowhouse Farm too greatly as in recent years milk output has increased to supply a milk round.
